channel.description: Last 10 notes on Milky Quartz, a note garden üå±üñ•Ô∏è

item.title: Kubernetes theory
item.description: Kubernetes For more low-level practical stuff, go to docs on Docker and K8s basics. For what reason? Kubernetes can be referred to as the ‚Äúoperating system of the cloud native world‚Äù.

item.title: Unix permissions
item.description: Unix permissions with chmod Useful examples: Make it executable: chmod +x ./run.sh Root only file access: chmod 000 ~/.creds Read-only exclusively for file owner: chmod 400 ./special-toy ...

item.title: Linux kernel
item.description: The Linux Kernel docs.kernel.org README Click the following link for Linux Docs official README page. Most of information presented in this subchapter is a selective copy-paste or paraphrasing from the above website.

item.title: Bitflips
item.description: Bitflips Bitflip is a kind of memory error that is an unintentional state switch from 0 to 1 or vice versa. Typically it affects random access memory. Diagnosing bitflips In this Btrfs LKML 2025-01 thread, an Arch Linux user reported issues with their filesystem, sharing dmesg logs of Btrfs errors regarding leaf corruption, resulting in their filesystem going read-only: [ +0.000001] BTRFS critical (device nvme0n1p2): corrupt leaf: block=3279774253056 slot=66 extent bytenr=3148007481344 len=8192 invalid extent refs, have 1 expect >= inline 513 [ +0.000005] BTRFS info (device nvme0n1p2): leaf 3279774253056 gen 381142 total ptrs 198 free space 1189 owner 2 ..

item.title: CSS
item.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) CSS reset - a method of resetting default styling of some HTML tag, used by most browsers. It can be done, for example, like this: html, body, div, span, applet, object, iframe, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, blockquote, pre, a, abbr, acronym, address, big, cite, code, del, dfn, em, img, ins, kbd, q, s, samp, small, strike, strong, sub, sup, tt, var, b, u, i, center, dl, dt, dd, ol, ul, li, fieldset, form, label, legend, table, caption, tbody, tfoot, thead, tr, th, td, article, aside, canvas, details, embed, figure, figcaption, footer, header, hgroup, menu, nav, output, ruby, section, summary, time, mark, audio, video { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: 0; font-size: 100%; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; }.

item.title: Docker basics
item.description: Docker Docker Engine It runs the whole thing. Docker Build Build images from Dockerfiles. In terms of command line toys, there‚Äôs docker build and docker buildx build which is like build on rails.

item.title: OpenGraph
item.description: OpenGraph Protocol OpenGraph Protocol or OGP is a web standard for other web applications to create embedded content of your link. The simplest way to add OGP embed to your website, is to add this to its <head> tag: <meta property="og:title" content="netcatcat.net : subsite"> <meta property="og:type" content="website"> <meta property="og:url" content="netcatcat.net/subsite"> <meta property="og:image" content="netcatcat.net/assets/images/KBITY_TRANSEDEN_TEAL_HEHE_.png">.

item.title: PGP&GPG
item.description: PGP (Pretty Good Privacy) Pretty good tool for encryption & decryption, as well as verifying file integrity. GPG/GnuPG tool Gnu Privacy Guard - the best free tool (afaik) for doing things with PGP.

item.title: robots.txt
item.description: robots.txt A semi-informal standard made by Google to tell webscraping robots (provided they are polite; some aren‚Äôt) to fuck off. See official Google documentation here.
